title: 2012 Soil Health Info Day: "Catch and Release Nutrients" with Dr. Dwayne Beck SDSU Extension

tasks.task: Dakota Lakes Research Farm Visit and Agricultural Research
subtasks: Think about where you want to be in 100 years
Support Dakota Lakes Research Farm through membership or donation
Visit Dakota Lakes Research Farm (for those who haven't)
Learn about the 100% low-disturbance snow-till production system
Understand the role of cover cropping in biodiversity and nutrient management
Consider the energy efficiency and environmental impact of agricultural practices
Reflect on the goals and future sustainability of agricultural research
Acknowledge the importance of crop rotation and soil health in long-term productivity
Learn from international perspectives on sustainable agriculture (e.g., Australia, Brazil, Paraguay)
Understand the challenges and opportunities in managing weed pressure and biodiversity
Consider the role of technology and management in balancing agricultural productivity with environmental stewardship
